item.title: US navy man held in Iran since 2018 freed
item.description: A US navy veteran detained in Iran since 2018 has been freed and is on his way back home, his mother says.

item.title: UK phone hacking victims can sue publisher
item.description: Victims of phone hacking in the UK can sue the publisher of The Sun and the now-defunct News Of The World for alleged unlawful information gathering between 1996 and 2011, the High Court has ruled.

item.title: New charges against Minneapolis officers
item.description: US protests over the death of George Floyd in custody have dwindled overnight after prosecutors levelled new charges against four Minneapolis police officers implicated in the killing.

item.title: New virus worry for UK PM Boris Johnson
item.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson held a 45-minute socially distanced meeting with business minister Alok Sharma just hours before Sharma was taken ill and tested for the coronavirus, Johnson's spokesman says.

item.title: European Central Bank boosts recovery aid
item.description: The European Central Bank has boosted its pandemic emergency support program by 600 billion euros to 1.35 trillion euros in an effort to keep affordable credit flowing to the economy during the steep downturn caused by the virus outbreak.

item.title: Madeleine McCann dead: German prosecutor
item.description: Madeleine McCann, the British girl who disappeared in Portugal in 2007 aged just three, is dead, Germany's prosecutor says after identifying an imprisoned German child abuser as a murder suspect.

item.title: Aust journos assaulted in UK on live TV
item.description: An Australian reporter feared she would be stabbed to death on live television hours before an angry mob chased down her colleagues during protests in London.

item.title: Hong Kong anthem bill to enforce ‘respect’
item.description: Hong Kong's Legislative Council has passed a bill that will criminalise disrespect of China's national anthem, a move critics see as the latest sign of Beijing's tightening grip on the city.

item.title: Lions in NSW zoo attack won’t be put down
item.description: A pair of lions that mauled a female zookeeper inside an enclosure on the NSW South Coast will not be euthanised.

item.title: Flooding leaves 16 dead in Yemen
item.description: Floods have swept through Yemen amid heavy seasonal rains, leaving at least 16 people dead and flooding dozens of homes, security officials say.
